div1.opener:
Thos. O. Moore 1850-
Alexa La 7th March 1850 Dear Col
div1.p: On my return from the city about the middle of Feby I found your long & very welcome letter of the 6th Jan.y and was gratified to hear that all were well. I remained in the city a month, two weeks of the time on my back very ill, many of my friends thought the jig was up, but it was another failure & I am now as stout & as healthy as ever, the fact is, I am kept so cornfounded busy that I have not time to think of being sick or dying within. My last years expenses has almost ruined me, so you see that a man has molly to break before he is prepared for sugar, they were very little short of Twenty Thousand dollars, and not yet near fixed as I wish to be & hope to be if I live.

I red a letter from Sarah expressing a wish to sour three of the negroes that are to be sold, & wants my aid, my opinion in regard to the matter coincides with yours (vig) as they are to be sold under excention they will sell high & for mor than this value, I shall therefore advise Sarah is such should be the case to let them go, if the oldest should sell for no mor than what she should be worht to her, & you or Butler will bug her for her & wifoverur of it, I will remit the amt to you immediately through Hill McLean Hes. but it is nonsense for one not able, to pay a high price for a negro be-
cause they raised them. The fact is if I live, in a year or two I intend to try & do something for Sarah, but I have worn ??? out that idea to her for fear of Brothers relaxing in his excecutions to make a suport for his family, as I suppose he is already lazy enough. If you find it convenient to ??? over of them for her at a fair price you shall be refunded immediately in the aut.. if so had you not better take the title in my name, however act in that matter as you please, my object bring to prevent her bring horrassed by conditions.

I hope to make with a fair season at least four hundred hogsheads sugar this season, if so, I think I shall go north next summer & will spend a short time in Turn. I have been expecting Tom down for some time Dr Butlers formerly have been with us for six weeks & will remain with us until his return from Baton Rouge he bring in the senate from Natchetchez

We are all in good health, Erin is off at school & well. Give our best love to Cousin Patsy & family, love & family, Aunt Butler, & all our friends, & accept my sincere progress for the good health of all & your cousin to Democracy
div1.closer:
Your Friend & relative Tho. O. Moore I have not time to say any thing about poor old jack, but will in my next
Take cousin Patsy & come down & spend a few weeks this spring, I will write Sarah in a day or two. I would write more but my ??? hurt my head hurt my hand so much this morning that I can not for the pain
